intro: Cnidium cuneatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cnidium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic compounds. The plant typically has slender stems and bipinnate leaves with a distinct, spicy scent. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. Cnidium cuneatum is often used in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties.
